elements.content: How It Works: A Real Configuration Example
Scenario: You want to send only ERROR logs to Splunk, mask credit card numbers, and drop all DEBUG logs entirely.

content.code:
# expanso-pipeline.yaml
name: production-logs
source:
  type: application-logs
  path: /var/log/app/*.log

filters:
  # Drop all DEBUG logs (typically 60-70% of volume)
  - type: drop
    condition: log_level == "DEBUG"
    
  # Only keep ERROR and WARN for Splunk
  - type: keep
    condition: log_level in ["ERROR", "WARN"]

transformations:
  # Mask credit card numbers
  - type: mask
    field: message
    pattern: \d{4}-\d{4}-\d{4}-\d{4}
    replacement: "****-****-****-****"
    
  # Add metadata
  - type: enrich
    fields:
      environment: production
      processed_by: expanso

routing:
  # Send to Splunk
  - destination: splunk
    endpoint: https://splunk.company.com:8088
    auth: ${SPLUNK_TOKEN}
    
  # Also send to S3 for archival (compressed)
  - destination: s3
    bucket: company-logs-archive
    compression: gzip

elements.content: Debug logs (70% of volume) never reach Splunk. ERROR logs arrive masked and enriched. Splunk bill drops by $280K/year. Compliance team happy. Data team happy. CFO very happy.
